alert.note: Alert for Gila; Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 5:54PM MST until August 17 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR GILA AND MARICOPA COUNTIES... At 554 PM MST, Heavy rain fell across Campaign Creek over the past few hours. Radar estimates between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Roosevelt, Tonto National Monument and Roosevelt Estates. This includes AZ Route 188 between mile markers 229 and 238. This includes the following streams and drainages... Campaign Creek, Salt River, Tonto Creek, Pine Creek, Burnt Corral Creek and Reavis Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
